meanings.definition: Similar in appearance or character to someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The two houses on the street looked very semblable with their red roofs.
meanings.sent2: The twins were so semblable that even their own parents sometimes mixed them up.
meanings.sent3: It was quite funny to see the dog's semblable expression when it saw its reflection in the mirror.
meanings.sent4: The artist's painting was so semblable to the original scene that it seemed like a photograph.
meanings.sent5: The actress's costume was so semblable to the historical figure she was portraying that it was like stepping back in time.

meanings.definition: Resembling or having the likeness of something else.
meanings.sent1: The cake she baked was so delicious, it was almost semblable to a professional baker's creation.
meanings.sent2: The forged signature on the document was so semblable to the real one that it fooled many people.
meanings.sent3: The toy car's semblable design to a real sports car made it a popular choice among children.
meanings.sent4: The actor's performance was so semblable to the original character that it felt like watching a documentary.
meanings.sent5: The new building's architecture was so semblable to the ancient ruins nearby that it blended seamlessly into the landscape.
